Bible religion is not made up of theological systems, creeds, theories, and tradition, for then it would not remain a mystery. The worldly would understand it through their own natural abilities. But religion, Bible religion, has a practical, saving energy, elements proceeding wholly from God--a personal experience of God's power transforming the entire man.--Ms 30, 1889, p. 23. ("Experience Following the Minneapolis Conference," circa June, 1889.)
